channel.title: RNZ New Zealand Headlines
channel.description: The Latest New Zealand headlines from RNZ News

item.title: Covid-19: Developments in New Zealand on 7 May
item.description: The PM has unveiled details around level 2, an exemption from border restrictions for international students may be on the cards, and support for sports has been a big focus.

item.title: New law on way to enforce rules for level 2
item.description: The government continues to insist there were no gaps in the enforcement powers of police during the level 4 lockdown, or under level 3.

item.title: Covid-19 alert level 2 details: What you need to know
item.description: With the prime minister unveiling the details on level 2, here are all the basic changes you can expect and what rules will apply when we do move.

item.title: Covid-19: 91yo learning Māori in lockdown - 'I'm so lucky'
item.description: Val Nicholson, at 91 and legally blind, is learning Māori and doing a spot of dancing around the house during lockdown - and her family thinks she deserves a shout-out for how she's handling it all.

item.title: Redundant hotel worker: 'We've never felt so helpless'
item.description: Thousands of tourism and aviation workers have been left reeling in the wake of widespread redundancies.

item.title: International Auckland masterclasses a winner during lockdown
item.description: Edith Salzmann and Wolfgang Kraemer have found an exciting way to motivate their young classical music students "at this crazy time" by running an international series of masterclasses.

item.title: International students may be allowed into NZ before border opens
item.description: New Zealand may allow international students to come to this country under quarantine conditions, before the borders are opened up again to other foreign nationals.

item.title: Fears of measles resurgence as vaccinations drop away in lockdown
item.description: The director of the immunisation advisory centre is worried that child vaccination programmes are being delayed, which could lead to a resurgence of measles.

item.title: Young ACT to investigate sexual harassment of vice president
item.description: The ACT party's youth wing says it will be conducting an investigation, after one of its senior members claimed she was sexually harassed.

item.title: Auckland water restrictions: City braces for another dry spell
item.description: The Auckland Council's decision to impose mandatory water restrictions is the first in more than 25 years as the city faces its worst drought in history.

item.title: As it happened: Covid-19 updates from NZ and around the world
item.description: NZers will no longer have to stick to their bubbles under alert level 2, the PM has confirmed today. See how the day's Covid-19 news unfolded with RNZ's live blog.

item.title: Two arrested in relation to burglary of nearly 50 barbecues
item.description: Two people have been arrested in connection with dozens of barbecues stolen from a Mitre 10 Mega store in East Auckland earlier this week.

item.title: Covid-19: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern reveals alert level 2 rules
item.description: Jacinda Ardern has outlined what life will look like under level 2, including details on retailing, hospitality, sport, education and travel. Watch the briefing here.

item.title: One new confirmed case of Covid-19 in New Zealand
item.description: Director-General of Health Dr Ashley Bloomfield has revealed the country has had just one new confirmed case of Covid-19 reported in NZ in the past 24 hours. Watch the latest briefing here.

item.title: PPE distribution to community support workers 'appropriate'
item.description: A review for the Health Minister has found the way personal protection equipment is being distributed to community support workers is appropriate.

item.title: IAG should pay out for two quakes, homeowner tells Appeal Court
item.description: A Christchurch homeowner has taken IAG to the Appeal Court over whether he can be paid for damage from separate earthquakes.

item.title: Auckland council approves water restrictions to combat drought
item.description: Auckland councillors have voted to impose mandatory water restrictions from next week due to the region's ongoing drought.

item.title: Vodafone network down across central North Island after cable cut
item.description: Vodafone's mobile and broadband network users experienced significant disruption in the central North Island, after a cable was cut by a roading contractor.
